entries.text: Thank you for calling StellarTech Customer Support. Please describe the reason for your call.
Yeah, I'm calling about a return. I ordered a stupid gadget last week, and it's completely useless. I want to send it back.
I understand, I can help with that. Could you please provide your order number so I can pull up your information?
Ugh, hold on... *rustling sounds* Okay, it's #ST789234. Just tell me how to return this thing. What's the return window?
Thank you. I see your order here. According to our VeloFit return policy, you have 30 days from the date of delivery to initiate a return.
30 days? I got it, like, a week ago! So just tell me how to get my money back! Is there a restocking fee?

To process a return, we will need you to repackage the item in its original packaging, if possible. Let me check on the restocking fee for this particular item. Also, are you requesting a return shipping label?
A restocking fee?! Are you kidding me? For a defective product? And you expect me to pay for the shipping label too?! This is ridiculous!

Sir, I understand your frustration. Let me review the details of your order and see if we can waive the restocking fee, depending on the nature of the issue. To assist you further can you describe the fault with the item?

Forget it! It's just... it's not working as advertised. It's flimsy, cheap garbage. And I can't believe you people are trying to nickel and dime me over this. The VeloFit return policy sounds like a scam!

Sir, I apologize that you're not satisfied with the product. I'm happy to help you process this return within the 30 days allowed by our VeloFit return policy. Let me check again about waiving the restocking fee.
No, you know what? Nevermind. I'm done. This is a waste of my time. I'll just dispute the charge with my credit card company.
Sir, please don't hang up. I can still assist you. I can arrange a return shipping label...
